rules_and_restrictions.evaluation_consistency_description: There is no evaluation consistency at Lucid Trading.
rules_and_restrictions.funded_consistency_description: Lucid Trading has 35% funded consistency in their LucidPro accounts, and 20% funded consistency in their LucidDirect accounts.
rules_and_restrictions.copy_trading_description: Copy trading is allowed with Lucid Trading.
rules_and_restrictions.algorithmic_trading_description: Lucid Trading allows algorithmic trading strategies, but highfrequency trading (HFT) bots are not permitted.
rules_and_restrictions.scalping_hold_time_description: The micro scalping policy at Lucid Trading states that 50% or more of your profits must come from trades held longer than 5 seconds.
rules_and_restrictions.news_trading_description: News trading is allowed with Lucid Trading.
rules_and_restrictions.inactivity_rule_description: Lucid Trading inactivity rule states that a trader must place a minimum of one trade every 20 days.
rules_and_restrictions.clear_path_to_live_description: Traders are moved to a LucidLive account under two possible conditions: After completing their final (sixth) payout in LucidPro or LucidDirect, or at the discretion of Lucid Trading, if risk managers determine a trader is ready for live trading before the sixth payout.

faq.question: What is the difference between LucidTest and LucidDirect?
faq.answer: LucidTest is an evaluation program where you need to pass profit targets and drawdown limits to get funded. LucidDirect is a straight-to-funded program where you start trading with real money immediately without an evaluation phase.

faq.question: How do payouts work?
faq.answer: Payouts are available after 10 trading days with minimum profit requirements. You keep 90% of profits with a 10% split to Lucid. Minimum payout is $500 with no maximum limit.

faq.question: What is LucidScale?
faq.answer: LucidScale is a feature that automatically raises your daily loss limit to 60% of your best end-of-day profit, allowing for more flexible trading as you become profitable.

faq.question: Is there an activation fee?
faq.answer: No, there are no activation fees for Lucid accounts. You only pay the monthly subscription for LucidTest or the one-time fee for LucidDirect.

faq.question: What happens if I hit the drawdown limit?
faq.answer: If you hit the maximum drawdown limit, your account will be closed. For LucidTest, you can restart the evaluation. For LucidDirect, you would need to purchase a new account.

faq.question: Can I trade during news events?
faq.answer: Yes, Lucid Trading does not have any restrictions on trading news. This applies to both evaluation and funded accounts. The firm just cautions about slippage and velocity logic.

faq.question: What is the minimum trading days to pass evaluation?
faq.answer: LucidTest evaluation accounts require 2 days minimum due to the 50% consistency rule. Your biggest day cannot exceed 50% of the profit target. LucidDirect funded accounts have no minimum days since they don't have consistency requirements.
